Part of the prob­lem is the availability of sources; we do not have the detailed chronologies we do for the Mao and Deng eras. The argument that Jiang and Hu had ­grand strategies is unusual; their dullness has been such as to obscure their g­ rand strategy. But clinging to a tried and tested course and keeping the state afloat—­ especially when that state was China—­required ­g rand strategy as much as luck
